metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15399 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use after free in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.89 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1213
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1213
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1213
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1213
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1213
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1213').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
